title: Updated Failed: Unspecified Error Received

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Hi,
while patching i receive an unspecified Error.
i already reinstalled league with no difference when i hit repair same issue (before i uninstalled the game the repair function was checking about 600 files before i got the error).
about 8 hours ago it was still working

what i have tried already:
reinstalling,repair, disable antivir/firewall
patcher troubleshooting https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues
i also changed my dns-sever just to be sure.

greetings

replies.body: I'm currently having the same problem :/

Hey TheNameIsAli,

Although the issue has been resolved, we're still not sure why this error only manifested for some players. We have a few leads but need your help! 

Please help us out by answering the following 2 questions :)
_I made sure to list some steps but let me know if you need assistance! 
_

*** When was the last time you ran Windows Update?**

1. You can see this by going to **Start**, then type **Windows Update** and press **Enter**
2. Then on the left click on **View Update History** and on the far right you'll see the column **Date Installed**
3. What is the date listed at the very top of **Date Installed**?

*** Is automatic root certificate update turned off?**

_You can see this by doing the following:_

1. Click **Start**, and then type **Run **and press enter.
2. In run type **gpedit.msc** and then click **OK**.
3. If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click **Continue**.
4. Under **computer configuration**, Double-click **Administrative Templates**, double-click **System**, double-click **Internet Communication Management**, and then click **Internet Communication settings**.
5. Double-click **Turn off Automatic Root Certificates Update**.
6. At the top left you'll see **Not Configured**, **Enabled ** and **Disabled**. Which one is selected?
I have the exact same problem{{item:3070}}

Hey Deztkh,

Although the issue has been resolved, we're still not sure why this error only manifested for some players. We have a few leads but need your help! 

Please help us out by answering the following 2 questions :)

*** When was the last time you ran Windows Update?**

*** Is automatic root certificate update turned off?**

_You can see this by doing the following:_

1. Click **Start**, and then type **Run **and press enter.
2. In run type **gpedit.msc** and then click **OK**.
3. If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click **Continue**.

5. Double-click **Turn off Automatic Root Certificates Update**.
6. At the top left you'll see **Not Configured**, **Enabled ** and **Disabled**. Which one is selected?

at least we are not alone. lets hope time will help because it seems like a riot issue.
@wizzard thx for the advice i tried most of it already

Hey K17W,

Although the issue has been resolved, we're still not sure why this error only manifested for some players. We have a few leads but need your help! 

Please help us out by answering the following 2 questions :)
_I made sure to list some steps but let me know if you need assistance! 
_

*** When was the last time you ran Windows Update?**

1. You can see this by going to **Start**, then type **Windows Update** and press**Enter**
2. Then on the left click on **View Update History** and on the far right you'll see the column **Date Installed**
3. What is the date listed at the very top of **Date Installed**?

*** Is automatic root certificate update turned off?**

_You can see this by doing the following:_

1. Click **Start**, and then type **Run **and press enter.
2. In run type **gpedit.msc** and then click **OK**.
3. If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then click **Continue**.
4. Under **computer configuration**, Double-click **Administrative Templates**, double-click **System**, double-click **Internet Communication Management**, and then click **Internet Communication settings**.
5. Double-click **Turn off Automatic Root Certificates Update**.
6. At the top left you'll see **Not Configured**, **Enabled ** and **Disabled**. Which one is selected?

Unspecified errors could be due to different reasons depending on what % you received an error.  There was also an[ issue with the patcher yesterday](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/live-incident-breakdown-na/9GYNI2JK-aug-23-patching-errors-for-a-patch-we-havent-released-yet) that caused some players to receive errors even though the new patch wasn't live yet.   If this was the case for you, everything should be okay now.  Let me know if you still have any problems with this!
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/UP3Z7Nsl-update-patch-617-fails this looks like the same issue we're all describing here. Maybe watch this space too?

Greetings Summoner!
Check [this](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/qGY56UB4-comprehensive-troubleshooting-your-patching-issues) out, it might help you resolve your problems.
